5 | Page   
  ABSTRACT  
  
 
The AGROCARE system is an IoT -based irrigation automation solution designed to 
optimize water usage in agriculture. It employs a NodeMCU microcontroller, soil moisture sensors, 
DHT11 sensor, and Blynk app for monitoring and controlling irrigation. The syst em ensures 
efficient water use by activating a pump when soil moisture levels drop below 15%. It also provides 
real-time data on soil moisture, temperature, and humidity via an LCD display and sends 
notifications to the user through the Blynk app. By integ rating these technologies farmers can 
improve water management, optimize irrigation, boost productivity, conserve resources, and reduce 
manual labour.

6 | Page   
  INTRODUCTION  
  
Agriculture is the backbone of many economies, providing food and raw materials essential 
for daily life and industrial processes. Efficient agricultural practices are vital for ensuring food 
security and sustainable development. However, one of the persis tent challenges in agriculture is 
managing irrigation effectively. Traditional irrigation methods, such as manual watering or fixed 
timer  irrigation systems, often lead to suboptimal water use. These methods can result in either 
over-watering or under -watering, negatively impacting crop health and leading to water wastage. 
Over -watering can cause waterlogging, which deprives plant roots of necessary oxygen, leading to 
root rot and other diseases. Under -watering, on the other hand, can stress plants, reducing their 
growth and yield. In both cases, inefficient water use not on ly affects crop production but also 
depletes valuable water resources, which is especially critical in regions facing water scarcity. With 
the advancement of technology, the Internet of Things (IoT) offers promising solutions to these 
challenges. IoT -based systems can provide precise and automated control over agricultural 
processes, enhancing efficiency and reducing human intervention. By integrating sensors, 
microcontrollers, and wireless communication, IoT systems can monitor environmental conditions 
in real time and make data -driven decisions to optimize resource use. The AGROCARE system 
aims to improve irrigation efficiency by automating water delivery based on real -time soil 
conditions. By reducing water wastage and ensuring optimal soil moisture levels, the system 
contributes to sustainable agricultural practices and better crop management. The integration of IoT 
technology not only simplifies the irrigation process  but also empowers farmers with valuable 
insights and control over their irrigation systems.

7 | Page   
  PROBLEM STATEMENT  
  
 
In recent times the traditional methods of agriculture are quite inefficient and unsustainable, as 
they depend on unpredictable factors such as rainfall, soil quality, and pest infestation. Farmers 
lack access to real -time data and insights on their crop c onditions and environmental parameters, 
which leads to low productivity, high costs, and poor quality. Conventional irrigation methods can 
result in either over -watering or under -watering, leading to inefficient water usage and potentially 
harming crop hea lth. There is a need for a smart irrigation system that can automatically adjust 
water supply based on soil moisture levels, providing timely notifications and control to the user. 
The system should be affordable, easy to use, and scalable, and should help  farmers improve their 
crop yield, reduce their resource consumption, and enhance their decision making.

8 | Page   
  METHODOLOGY  
  
The system consists of interconnected components managed by the NodeMCU 
microcontroller. The soil moisture sensor continuously monitors soil conditions and sends data to 
the NodeMCU. When the soil moisture falls below the set threshold (15%), the NodeMCU a ctivates 
the relay, which switches on the pump. The DHT11 sensor provides environmental data, which is 
displayed on the LCD. The Blynk app offers a user interface for monitoring and manual control.  
 
 
Fig. 1 Block Diagram of the System  
  
The block diagram illustrates the architecture of the AGROCARE IoT -based irrigation 
automation system. The core component of the system is the NodeMCU (ESP8266) 
microcontroller, which orchestrates the functioning of various sensors and devices.   
  
  
Fig.2 System setup  
The above picture Fig. 2 shows the experimental  setup of the smart irrigation system , AGR OCAR E.

9 | Page   
  COMPONENTS AND SPECIFICATION:  
 
The components of AGROCARE system are:  
• NodeMCU  (Microcontroller):   Acts as the brain of the system, processing data from 
sensors and controlling the pump.  
• Soil Moisture Sensor : Measures the moisture content of the soil. The pump is activated 
when moisture is below 15%.  
• DHT11 Sensor : Monitors temperature and humidity levels.  
• LM317 : Used for voltage regulation to control the motor.  
• Relay : Switches the pump on and off based on signal from NodeMCU.  
• 7805 Voltage Regulator : Powers the soil moisture sensor and DHT11 sensor.  
• Pump : 9W DC motor is used to d eliver  water to the soil when activated.  
• LCD Display : Shows real -time soil moisture, temperature, and humidity.  
• Blynk App : Displays motor status, allows manual control, and sends notifications when 
the pump is activated.  
  
The flowchart Fig. 3 illustrates the operational workflow of the AGROCARE IoT -based 
irrigation automation system. This diagram outlines the sequence of steps and decision -making 
processes involved in monitoring environmental conditions and controlling the irrigation pump.  
 
Check Wi -Fi Name and Password:   
The system begins by verifying the Wi -Fi credentials. This is crucial for establishing a connection 
with the Blynk cloud for remote monitoring and control. If the Wi -Fi name and password are 
correct, the process moves to the next step. If not, the system w ill keep checking until valid 
credentials are provided.  
 
LCD and Sensors Initialization:   
Once the Wi -Fi connection is established, the system initializes the LCD display and the connected 
sensors (DHT11 for temperature and humidity, and the soil moisture sensor).  This ensures that all 
components are ready to start data collection and display.

10 | Page   
   
  
Fig.3 Flow chart of AGROCAR E system  
  
Read Data from DHT11 and Soil Moisture Sensor:   
The NodeMCU reads the current temperature, humidity, and soil moisture levels from the 
DHT11 and soil moisture sensors, respectively. Collecting this data is essential for monitoring the 
environmental conditions and making decisions about irrigation.  
 
Display Data on LCD:   
The collected data (temperature, humidity, and soil moisture levels) is displayed on the 
LCD screen. This provides a real -time visual representation of the environmental conditions for 
local monitoring.  
  
Input

11 | Page   
  Send Data to Blynk Cloud:   
The NodeMCU sends the collected data to the Blynk cloud. This allows the user to 
remotely monitor the environmental conditions and irrigation status through the Blynk app on their 
smartphone.  
Check Condition:   
The system evaluates the soil moisture level against a predefined threshold (e.g., 15%).  
Based on this condition, the system decides whether to turn the pump on or off.  
If Soil Moisture is Below Threshold:  
The pump is turned on to irrigate the soil.  
If Soil Moisture is Above Threshold:  
The pump remains off to prevent over -watering.  
  
Pump Control (Motor On/Off):   
Based on the decision from the previous step, the relay is activated to either turn the pump on 
or keep it off. This ensures that irrigation is carried out only when necessary, optimizing water 
usage and maintaining optimal soil moisture levels.

12 | Page   
  RESULTS  
  
The AGROCARE system was tested extensively to ensure its functionality and efficiency. 
The primary outcomes of the project are summarized below:  
Automatic Pumping : 
The automatic pumping feature is a key component of the AGROCARE system. When the 
soil moisture level falls below the predefined threshold of 15%, the system automatically activates 
the pump to water the plants. This ensures that the plants receive adequat e water without any 
manual intervention.  
 
 
Fig.4  Automatic Pumping Action  
 
Manual Pumping : 
The AGROCARE system also supports manual control via the Blynk app. Users can 
manually activate or deactivate the pump through the app, providing flexibility and control over 
the irrigation process. The r esults is sho wn in Fig.5.

13 | Page   
    
Fig.5  Manual Pumping via Blynk App  
 
Monitoring and Notifications via Blynk App   
The Blynk app plays a crucial role in monitoring the system's status and providing 
notifications. It displays real -time data on soil moisture, temperature, and humidity. When the 
pump is activated either automatically or manually, the app sends a notificat ion to the user, 
ensuring they are always informed about the irrigation status.  
 
 
Fig.6  Blynk App Interface

14 | Page   
  LCD Display   
The system includes an LCD display that shows real -time values of soil moisture, 
temperature, and humidity. This provides an immediate visual confirmation of the environmental 
conditions and system status.  
❖ The sensors accurately measured the soil moisture, ensuring that the irrigation was done only 
when necessary. This helped in conserving water and maintaining optimal soil moisture levels.  
❖ The Blynk app's user -friendly interface allowed users to monitor and control the system 
remotely. Notifications about pump status and environmental conditions were timely and 
helpful, enhancing the overall user experience.  
❖ During testing, the system consistently performed as expected, with the relay effectively 
switching the pump on and off based on sensor readings. The use of the NodeMCU 
microcontroller ensured stable and reliable communication between the sensors, the pump , and 
the Blynk app.  
❖ The use of affordable components like the NodeMCU, DHT11 sensor, and soil moisture 
sensors made the AGROCARE system cost -effective. This makes it accessible to a wide range 
of users, including small -scale farmers.

15 | Page   
  CONCLUSIONS & FUTURE WORK   
  
 
The AGROCARE system successfully demonstrates the potential of IoT in automating and 
optimizing irrigation processes. By providing real -time monitoring and control, it enhances water 
use efficiency and ensures better crop health. The integration with the B lynk app allows for 
convenient remote management and timely notifications, making it a valuable tool for modern 
agriculture. Future iterations of the AGROCARE system could focus on scaling up for larger 
agricultural fields. This would involve integrating more sensors and pumps, as well as enhancing 
the communication range. Incorporating data analytics and machine learning could provide 
predictive insights into irrigation needs, further optimizing water use and improving crop yields.  
To make the system more sustainable, future versions could integrate solar panels to power the 
sensors and pump, reducing reliance on external power sources. Integrating weather forecast data 
could allow the system to adjust irrigation schedules based on upcoming weather conditions, 
preventing unnecessary watering before rain. By addressing these future enhancements, the 
AGROCARE system can become even more efficient and beneficial for sustainable agriculture.
